content.question: Let <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the region in the first quadrant bounded by the graph of <math alttext="y equals, 4 times e to the x power, plus 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, the line <math alttext="x equals 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, and the <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>- and <math alttext="y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-axes. <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is the base of a solid whose cross sections perpendicular to the <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-axis are semicircles. What is the volume of the solid?

choices.label: <math alttext="pi times, open parenthesis, e squared, plus 2 e, minus five halves, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>π</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>e</mi><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="pi times, open parenthesis, 2 times e squared, plus 4 e, minus 5, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>π</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>e</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="pi times, open parenthesis, 4 times e squared, plus 8 e, minus 10, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>π</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>4</mn><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>8</mn><mi>e</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>10</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="pi times, open parenthesis, 8 times e squared, plus 16 e, minus 20, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>π</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>8</mn><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>16</mn><mi>e</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>20</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="pi times, open parenthesis, e squared, plus 2 e, minus five halves, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>π</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>e</mi><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 8.8: Volumes with Cross Sections - Triangles and Semicircles

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Apply an appropriate mathematical definition, theorem, or test.
